meanings.definition: To go back or move backward
meanings.sent1: The car began to retrocede slowly down the hill.
meanings.sent2: After realizing the mistake, he decided to retrocede and take a different route.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to retrocede when it saw the big dog approaching.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts seemed to retrocede to a simpler time when life was easier.
meanings.sent5: The river's current seemed to retrocede, revealing hidden treasures beneath the surface.

meanings.sent1: The soldiers had to retrocede from the battlefield due to the enemy's advance.
meanings.sent2: Feeling overwhelmed, she chose to retrocede from the stressful situation.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to retrocede from the bird feeder when it saw the angry birds approaching.
meanings.sent4: His confidence retroceded like a wave retreating from the shore.
meanings.sent5: The shadows seemed to retrocede as the sun rose higher in the sky.

meanings.definition: To revert to a previous state or condition
meanings.sent1: The software update caused the system to retrocede to an older version.
meanings.sent2: Despite the progress made, the project seemed to retrocede to its initial stages.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome appeared to retrocede to its original position every night.
meanings.sent4: Her mood retroceded to gloominess after hearing the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The town's architecture seemed to retrocede to a time long forgotten.
